meta.title: The Sanctuary | Residential Interior Renovation | Construction Portfolio
meta.description: Case study of The Sanctuary, a residential interior renovation focused on curved architectural details, premium finishes, and coordinated execution.
meta.ogDescription: From framing and drywall to premium finishing, The Sanctuary highlights disciplined execution and high-end residential detailing.

hero.title: The Sanctuary
hero.summary: A premium interior renovation that transformed a standard living area into a warm, sculpted, and highly functional sanctuary.

role.label: Scope
role.value: Framing, drywall, finishing coordination and quality control

details.title: Project Details
details.body: The Sanctuary combined architectural framing, drywall precision, and premium finish integration to achieve a calm and luxurious interior atmosphere.

overview.title: Overview
overview.body: The objective was to modernize the interior while preserving a comfortable residential character. The design language focused on soft transitions, curated textures, and balanced lighting.

challenge.title: Challenge
challenge.body: The renovation required clean alignment across curved details, ceiling transitions, and multiple finishing trades without compromising schedule or visual continuity.

approach.title: Approach
approach.body: Work was executed in coordinated phases: site preparation, framing adjustments, drywall installation, progressive finishing, and final detail reviews. Daily communication kept sequencing predictable and quality consistent.

highlights.title: Highlights
items: Custom framing support for architectural ceiling features
Drywall and finishing workflow optimized for smooth transitions
Material staging and trade coordination to reduce delays
Final detailing aligned with high-end residential expectations

credits.title: Credits
credits.body: Construction execution and site coordination by the project team in collaboration with client-selected design and finishing partners.

cta.body: Let’s discuss your scope, schedule, and finish requirements.
